intro: Distephanus mahafaly, commonly known as the Mahafaly star, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are arranged opposite each other on the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
